Description: Ostracon, section (two fragments) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394368) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394368)
